citation.article-title: Perlucidibaca piscinae gen. nov., sp. nov., a freshwater bacterium belonging to the family Moraxellaceae.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Perlucidibaca (Per.lu.ci.di.ba′ca. L. adj. perlucidus transparent, pellucid; L. fem. n. baca a small round fruit, a berry; N.L. fem. n. Perlucidibaca a transparent berry).
Anaerobic growth is similar to aerobic growth.
Cells are short rods that are motile by a polar flagellum.
Acid is not produced from glucose fermentation.
Predominant cellular fatty acids are C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH, C18 : 1ω7c, C12 : 0 3-OH and C12 : 0.
The DNA G+C content is 63.1 mol%.
The major respiratory quinone is Q-8.
Phylogenetically, the genus belongs to the family Moraxellaceae.
The type species is Perlucidibaca piscinae.
